meanings.sent1: In the kingdom, the noblesse held great power and influence.
meanings.sent2: She carried herself with the grace and dignity of noblesse.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted as if it belonged to the noblesse of the feline world.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity elevated her to the noblesse of the community.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the palace reflected the noblesse of its inhabitants.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being noble or aristocratic.
meanings.sent1: His noblesse shone through in his actions and words.
meanings.sent2: The noblesse of her character was evident in every gesture.
meanings.sent3: The dog's noblesse was on full display as it pranced around the park.
meanings.sent4: The painting captured the essence of noblesse in its intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The noblesse of the old castle whispered tales of a bygone era.
